npayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"kind":"dev","methods":{"_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress(address,address)":{"custom:access-control":"No explicit access control - relies on deployment sequence","custom:integration":"Critical for NameService and Treasury functionality","custom:security":"Single-use function - can only be called once","details":"Can only be called once due to breaker flag mechanism for security Critical Setup Process: - Validates the breaker flag is active (prevents multiple calls) - Sets the NameService contract address for identity resolution in payments - Configures the Treasury contract address for privileged balance operations - Provides initial Principal Token balance (10,000 MATE) to NameService for operations - Registers NameService as a privileged staker for enhanced functionality and rewards Security Features: - Single-use function protected by breaker flag - Prevents unauthorized reconfiguration of critical system addresses - Must be called during initial system deployment phase Initial Token Distribution: - NameService receives 10,000 MATE tokens for operational expenses - NameService gains staker privileges for transaction processing - Enables identity-based payment resolution throughout the ecosystem","params":{"_nameServiceAddress":"Address of the deployed NameService contract for identity resolution","_treasuryAddress":"Address of the Treasury contract for balance management operations"}},"acceptAdmin()":{"details":"Can only be called by the proposed admin after the time delay"},"acceptImplementation()":{"details":"Executes the proxy upgrade to the new implementation contract"},"addAmountToUser(address,address,uint256)":{"custom:access-control":"Only treasury contract","custom:security":"No overflow protection needed due to controlled access","details":"Restricted function that can only be called by the authorized treasury contract Treasury Operations: - Allows treasury to mint or credit tokens to user accounts - Used for reward distributions, airdrops, or token bridging - Direct balance manipulation bypasses normal transfer restrictions - No signature verification required (treasury authorization) Access Control: - Only the registered treasury contract can call this function - Reverts with SenderIsNotTreasury error for unauthorized callers - Provides centralized token distribution mechanism Use Cases: - Cross-chain bridge token minting - Administrative reward distributions - System-level token allocations - Emergency balance corrections","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to add to the user's balance","token":"Address of the token contract to add balance for","user":"Address of the user to receive tokens"}},"addBalance(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"This function is intended for testnet use only to provide tokens for testing","params":{"quantity":"The amount of tokens to add to the user's balance","token":"The address of the token contract to add balance for","user":"The address of the user to receive the balance"}},"caPay(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Allows registered contracts to distribute tokens without signature verification Authorization Model: - Only smart contracts (non-EOA addresses) can call this function - Calling contract must have sufficient token balance - No signature verification required (contract-level authorization) - Used primarily for automated distributions and rewards Use Cases: - Staking contract reward distributions - NameService fee distributions - Automated system payouts - Cross-contract token transfers Security Features: - Validates caller is a contract (has bytecode) - Checks sufficient balance before transfer - Direct balance manipulation for efficiency","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to transfer from calling contract","to":"Address of the token recipient","token":"Address of the token contract to transfer"}},"constructor":{"custom:deployment":"Must be followed by NameService and Treasury setup","custom:security":"Admin address has full control over system configuration","details":"Sets up the core system parameters, admin roles, and initial Principal Token allocations Critical Initial Setup: - Configures admin address with full administrative privileges - Sets staking contract address for reward distribution and status management - Stores EVVM metadata including principal token address and reward parameters - Distributes initial MATE tokens to staking contract (2x reward amount) - Registers staking contract as privileged staker with full benefits - Activates breaker flag for one-time NameService and Treasury setup Token Distribution: - Staking contract receives 2x current reward amount in MATE tokens - Enables immediate reward distribution capabilities - Provides operational liquidity for staking rewards Security Initialization: - Sets admin.current for immediate administrative access - Prepares system for NameService and Treasury integration - Establishes staking privileges for the staking contract Post-Deployment Requirements: - Must call `_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress()` to complete integration - NameService and Treasury addresses must be configured before full operation - Implementation contract should be set for proxy functionality","params":{"_evvmMetadata":"Metadata structure containing principal token address, reward amounts, and system parameters","_initialOwner":"Address that will have administrative privileges over the contract","_stakingContractAddress":"Address of the staking contract for reward distribution and staker management"}},"disperseCaPay((uint256,address)[],address,uint256)":{"details":"Allows authorized contracts to distribute tokens to multiple recipients efficiently Batch Distribution Features: - Single call distributes to multiple recipients - Supports both direct addresses and identity resolution - Validates total amount matches sum of individual distributions - Optimized for contract-based automated distributions Authorization Model: - Only smart contracts can call this function - No signature verification required (contract authorization) - Calling contract must have sufficient balance for total distribution Use Cases: - Bulk reward distributions from staking contracts - Multi-recipient fee distributions - Batch payroll or dividend distributions - Cross-contract multi-party settlements","params":{"amount":"Total amount to distribute (must equal sum of individual amounts)","toData":"Array of recipient data containing addresses/identities and amounts","token":"Address of the token contract to distribute"}},"dispersePay(address,(uint256,address,string)[],address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,address,bytes)":{"details":"Efficient single-source multi-recipient payment distribution with signature verification Distribution Features: - Single signature authorizes distribution to multiple recipients - Supports both direct addresses and identity-based recipients - Proportional amount distribution based on recipient configurations - Integrated priority fee and staker reward system - Supports both sync and async nonce management Verification Process: - Validates single signature for entire distribution - Checks total amount and priority fee against sender balance - Ensures executor permissions and nonce validity - Processes each recipient distribution atomically Staker Benefits: - Executor receives priority fee (if staker) - MATE reward based on number of successful distributions","params":{"amount":"Total amount to distribute (must match sum of individual amounts)","executor":"Address authorized to execute this distribution","from":"Address of the payment sender","nonce":"Transaction nonce for replay protection","priorityFee":"Fee amount for the transaction executor","priorityFlag":"True for async nonce, false for sync nonce","signature":"Cryptographic signature authorizing this distribution","toData":"Array of recipient data with addresses/identities and amounts","token":"Address of the token contract to distribute"}},"getBalance(address,address)":{"details":"Returns the current balance stored in the EVVM system","params":{"token":"Token contract address to check","user":"Address to check balance for"},"returns":{"_0":"Current token balance for the user"}},"getCurrentAdmin()":{"details":"Returns the address with administrative privileges over the contract","returns":{"_0":"Address of the current admin"}},"getCurrentImplementation()":{"details":"Returns the implementation used by the proxy for delegatecalls","returns":{"_0":"Address of the current implementation contract"}},"getEraPrincipalToken()":{"details":"Returns the token supply threshold that triggers the next reward halving","returns":{"_0":"Current era tokens threshold"}},"getEvvmID()":{"details":"Returns the EvvmID used for distinguishing different EVVM deployments","returns":{"_0":"Unique EvvmID string"}},"getEvvmMetadata()":{"details":"Provides access to system-wide configuration and economic parameters Metadata Contents: - Principal token address (Principal Token) - Current reward amount per transaction - Total supply tracking - Era tokens threshold for reward transitions - System configuration parameters","returns":{"_0":"Complete EvvmMetadata struct with all system parameters"}},"getIfUsedAsyncNonce(address,uint256)":{"details":"Verifies nonce status to prevent replay attacks in async payments","params":{"nonce":"Specific nonce value to verify","user":"Address to check nonce usage for"},"returns":{"_0":"True if the nonce has been used, false if still available"}},"getNameServiceAddress()":{"details":"Returns the address used for identity resolution in payments","returns":{"_0":"Address of the integrated NameService contract"}},"getNextCurrentSyncNonce(address)":{"details":"Returns the expected nonce for the next sync payment transaction","params":{"user":"Address to check sync nonce for"},"returns":{"_0":"Next synchronous nonce value"}},"getNextFisherDepositNonce(address)":{"details":"Returns the expected nonce for the next cross-chain deposit","params":{"user":"Address to check deposit nonce for"},"returns":{"_0":"Next Fisher Bridge deposit nonce"}},"getPrincipalTokenTotalSupply()":{"details":"Returns the current total supply used for era transition calculations","returns":{"_0":"Total supply of MATE tokens"}},"getProposalAdmin()":{"details":"Returns the address pending approval for admin privileges","returns":{"_0":"Address of the proposed admin (zero if no pending proposal)"}},"getProposalImplementation()":{"details":"Returns the implementation pending approval for proxy upgrade","returns":{"_0":"Address of the proposed implementation contract (zero if none)"}},"getRewardAmount()":{"details":"Returns the base reward distributed to stakers for transaction processing","returns":{"_0":"Current reward amount in MATE tokens"}},"getStakingContractAddress()":{"details":"Returns the address that can modify staker status and receive rewards","returns":{"_0":"Address of the integrated staking contract"}},"getTimeToAcceptAdmin()":{"details":"Returns timestamp when the proposed admin can accept the role","returns":{"_0":"Timestamp when admin change can be executed (0 if no pending proposal)"}},"getTimeToAcceptImplementation()":{"details":"Returns timestamp when the proposed implementation can be accepted","returns":{"_0":"Timestamp when implementation upgrade can be executed (0 if no pending proposal)"}},"getWhitelistTokenToBeAdded()":{"details":"Returns the token address that can be whitelisted after time delay","returns":{"_0":"Address of the token prepared for whitelisting (zero if none)"}},"getWhitelistTokenToBeAddedDateToSet()":{"details":"Returns timestamp when prepared tokens can be added to whitelist","returns":{"_0":"Timestamp when pending token can be whitelisted (0 if no pending proposal)"}},"isAddressStaker(address)":{"details":"Verifies staker status for transaction processing privileges and rewards","params":{"user":"Address to check staker status for"},"returns":{"_0":"True if the address is a registered staker"}},"pay(address,address,string,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,address,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to transfer","executor":"Address authorized to execute this transaction (zero address = sender only)","from":"Address of the payment sender","nonce":"Transaction nonce","priorityFee":"Additional fee for transaction priority (not used in non-staker payments)","priorityFlag":"Execution type flag (false = sync nonce, true = async nonce)","signature":"Cryptographic signature authorizing this payment","to_address":"Direct recipient address (used if to_identity is empty)","to_identity":"Username/identity of recipient (resolved via NameService)","token":"Address of the token contract to transfer"}},"payMultiple((address,address,string,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,address,bytes)[])":{"details":"Executes an array of payment operations with individual success/failure tracking Batch Processing Features: - Processes each payment independently (partial success allowed) - Returns detailed results for each transaction - Supports both staker and non-staker payment types - Handles both sync and async nonce types per payment - Provides comprehensive transaction statistics Payment Validation: - Each payment signature is verified independently - Nonce management handled per payment type (sync/async) - Identity resolution performed for each recipient - Balance updates executed atomically per payment Return Values: - successfulTransactions: Count of completed payments - failedTransactions: Count of failed payments - results: Boolean array indicating success/failure for each payment","params":{"payData":"Array of PayData structures containing payment details"},"returns":{"failedTransactions":"Number of payments that failed","results":"Boolean array with success status for each payment","successfulTransactions":"Number of payments that completed successfully"}},"pointStaker(address,bytes1)":{"details":"Can only be called by the authorized staking contract Staker Status Management: - Controls who can earn staking rewards and process transactions - Integrates with external staking contract for validation - Updates affect payment processing privileges and reward eligibility Access Control: - Only the registered staking contract can call this function - Ensures staker status changes are properly authorized","params":{"answer":"Bytes1 flag indicating staker status/type","user":"Address to update staker status for"}},"proposeAdmin(address)":{"details":"Part of the time-delayed governance system for admin changes","params":{"_newOwner":"Address of the proposed new admin"}},"proposeImplementation(address)":{"details":"Part of the time-delayed governance system for critical upgrades Upgrade Security: - 30-day time delay for implementation changes - Only admin can propose upgrades - Allows time for community review and validation - Can be rejected before acceptance deadline","params":{"_newImpl":"Address of the new implementation contract"}},"recalculateReward()":{"details":"Implements deflationary tokenomics with halving mechanism and random rewards Era Transition Mechanism: - Activates when total supply exceeds current era token threshold - Moves half of remaining tokens to next era threshold - Halves the base reward amount for future transactions - Provides random Principal Token bonus to caller (1-5083x reward) Economic Impact: - Gradually reduces inflation through reward halving - Creates scarcity as era thresholds become harder to reach - Incentivizes early participation with higher rewards - Provides lottery-style bonus for triggering era transitions Requirements: - Total supply must exceed current era token threshold - Can be called by anyone when conditions are met"},"rejectProposalAdmin()":{"details":"Allows current admin to reject proposed admin changes"},"rejectUpgrade()":{"details":"Allows admin to reject proposed upgrades before the time delay expires"},"removeAmountFromUser(address,address,uint256)":{"custom:access-control":"Only treasury contract","custom:security":"No underflow protection - treasury responsibility","details":"Restricted function that can only be called by the authorized treasury contract Treasury Operations: - Allows treasury to burn or debit tokens from user accounts - Used for cross-chain bridging, penalties, or system corrections - Direct balance manipulation bypasses normal transfer protections - Can potentially create negative balances if not carefully managed Access Control: - Only the registered treasury contract can call this function - Reverts with SenderIsNotTreasury error for unauthorized callers - Provides centralized token withdrawal mechanism Use Cases: - Cross-chain bridge token burning - Administrative penalty applications - System-level token reclamations - Emergency balance corrections Security Considerations: - No underflow protection: treasury must ensure sufficient balance - Can result in unexpected negative balances if misused - Treasury contract should implement additional validation","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to remove from the user's balance","token":"Address of the token contract to remove balance for","user":"Address of the user to remove tokens from"}},"setEvvmID(uint256)":{"details":"Allows the admin to change the EVVM ID within a 1-day window after deployment"},"setNameServiceAddress(address)":{"details":"Allows admin to change the NameService integration address","params":{"_nameServiceAddress":"Address of the new NameService contract"}},"setPointStaker(address,bytes1)":{"details":"This function is intended for testnet use only to configure staker points for testing","params":{"answer":"The bytes1 value representing the staker status or answer","user":"The address of the user to set as point staker"}}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress(address,address)":{"notice":"One-time setup function to configure NameService and Treasury contract addresses"},"acceptAdmin()":{"notice":"Accepts a pending admin proposal and becomes the new admin"},"acceptImplementation()":{"notice":"Accepts a pending implementation upgrade after the time delay"},"addAmountToUser(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Adds tokens to a user's balance in the EVVM system"},"addBalance(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Faucet function to add balance to a user's account for testing purposes"},"caPay(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Contract-to-address payment function for authorized smart contracts"},"constructor":{"notice":"Initializes the EVVM contract with essential configuration and token distributions"},"disperseCaPay((uint256,address)[],address,uint256)":{"notice":"Contract-to-multiple-addresses payment distribution function"},"dispersePay(address,(uint256,address,string)[],address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,address,bytes)":{"notice":"Distributes tokens from a single sender to multiple recipients"},"getBalance(address,address)":{"notice":"Gets the balance of a specific token for a user"},"getCurrentAdmin()":{"notice":"Gets the current admin address"},"getCurrentImplementation()":{"notice":"Gets the current active implementation contract address"},"getEraPrincipalToken()":{"notice":"Gets the current era token threshold for reward transitions"},"getEvvmID()":{"notice":"Gets the unique identifier string for this EVVM instance"},"getEvvmMetadata()":{"notice":"Returns the complete EVVM metadata configuration"},"getIfUsedAsyncNonce(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Checks if a specific async nonce has been used by a user"},"getNameServiceAddress()":{"notice":"Gets the current NameService contract address"},"getNextCurrentSyncNonce(address)":{"notice":"Gets the next synchronous nonce for a user"},"getNextFisherDepositNonce(address)":{"notice":"Gets the next Fisher Bridge deposit nonce for a user"},"getPrincipalTokenTotalSupply()":{"notice":"Gets the total supply of the principal token (MATE)"},"getProposalAdmin()":{"notice":"Gets the proposed admin address"},"getProposalImplementation()":{"notice":"Gets the proposed implementation contract address"},"getRewardAmount()":{"notice":"Gets the current Principal Token reward amount per transaction"},"getStakingContractAddress()":{"notice":"Gets the authorized staking contract address"},"getTimeToAcceptAdmin()":{"notice":"Gets the acceptance deadline for the pending admin change"},"getTimeToAcceptImplementation()":{"notice":"Gets the acceptance deadline for the pending implementation upgrade"},"getWhitelistTokenToBeAdded()":{"notice":"Gets the address of the token pending whitelist approval"},"getWhitelistTokenToBeAddedDateToSet()":{"notice":"Gets the acceptance deadline for pending token whitelist proposals"},"isAddressStaker(address)":{"notice":"Checks if an address is registered as a staker"},"pay(address,address,string,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,address,bytes)":{"notice":"Processes single payments Payment Flow: - Validates signature authorization for the payment   (if synchronous nonce, uses nextSyncUsedNonce inside    the signature verification to verify the correct nonce) - Checks executor permission if specified - Validates synchronous nonce matches expected value - Resolves recipient address (identity or direct address) - If the fisher (msg.sender) is a staker:  - Transfers priority fee to the fisher  - Rewards the fisher with Principal tokens - Updates balances and increments nonce"},"payMultiple((address,address,string,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,address,bytes)[])":{"notice":"Processes multiple payments in a single transaction batch"},"pointStaker(address,bytes1)":{"notice":"Updates staker status for a user address"},"proposeAdmin(address)":{"notice":"Proposes a new admin address with 1-day time delay"},"proposeImplementation(address)":{"notice":"Proposes a new implementation contract for the proxy with time delay"},"recalculateReward()":{"notice":"Triggers a reward recalculation and era transition in the token economy"},"rejectProposalAdmin()":{"notice":"Cancels a pending admin change proposal"},"rejectUpgrade()":{"notice":"Cancels a pending implementation upgrade proposal"},"removeAmountFromUser(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Removes tokens from a user's balance in the EVVM system"},"setEvvmID(uint256)":{"notice":"Updates the EVVM ID with a new value, restricted to admin and time-limited"},"setNameServiceAddress(address)":{"notice":"Updates the NameService contract address for identity resolution"},"setPointStaker(address,bytes1)":{"notice":"Faucet function to set point staker status for testing ,"dweb:/ipfs/QmW9NvZPf6yJsvHvcaVVNRpNRWHEaKayj7jZzCk7k7EmPd"]},"src/contracts/nameService/lib/ErrorsLib.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa9a0aedaeab5c5e3ee05a5299e4648fc8110dd20aed7d416f11548daab475473","license":"EVVM-NONCOMMERCIAL-1.0","urls":["bzz-raw://678f719d0dbfabbeca907d97b8514bc22ddd853bb666d628815c2cff50fd5144","dweb:/ipfs/QmfUnWGJNaKoVpSVRuNCqNnrzSvz9gnxtunsrcY7LEbW1C"]},"src/contracts/nameService/lib/SignatureUtils.sol":{"keccak256":"0x09aa9a6516ad5c00bad329c2dd4392a762c9155d22395b861c76f7d0a5af3486","license":"EVVM-NONCOMMERCIAL-1.0","urls":["bzz-raw://4b293148d5aaf5a0cdb9ae1c2c4baa1b6d623d826407dd0dd40af3b92270d3de","dweb:/ipfs/QmWQShNLhwmwtkuF6zZEE4N5Wz3TAzUTDweYDGJwW8Vkyz"]},"src/library/AdvancedStrings.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe1c7f35ce6c0695fbbc53643d0d7c78335f6a5732a2774e43764140072d25f32","license":"EVVM-NONCOMMERCIAL-1.0","urls":["bzz-raw://ad71c8747d193960481ecdf8cda6baf8d276e0ce24e6936fff822c495efc52b1","dweb:/ipfs/QmfU6yHh3UTo2ssqcFHB5M5oABYN81cr3KLygRTxdA4MNM"]},"src/library/SignatureRecover.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2086abbd3af10084fae9f2258c1bae9a613c01ba870742ee75bdb4381cb5c4da","license":"EVVM-NONCOMMERCIAL-1.0","urls":["bzz-raw://b18d8110c0224ca5d9f9f307f2a9100b8ec47bc9aab91bb5dc8b421ccb1b0d6c","dweb:/ipfs/Qmav2KYbaSXvPDxagSNaVqNeTkX9vNNFZ2rQqAve5UwJkn"]}},"version":1}

_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress(addr.custom:access-control: No explicit access control - relies on deployment sequence
_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress(addr.custom:integration: Critical for NameService and Treasury functionality
_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress(addr.custom:security: Single-use function - can only be called once
_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress(addr.details: Can only be called once due to breaker flag mechanism for security Critical Setup Process: - Validates the breaker flag is active (prevents multiple calls) - Sets the NameService contract address for identity resolution in payments - Configures the Treasury contract address for privileged balance operations - Provides initial Principal Token balance (10,000 MATE) to NameService for operations - Registers NameService as a privileged staker for enhanced functionality and rewards Security Features: - Single-use function protected by breaker flag - Prevents unauthorized reconfiguration of critical system addresses - Must be called during initial system deployment phase Initial Token Distribution: - NameService receives 10,000 MATE tokens for operational expenses - NameService gains staker privileges for transaction processing - Enables identity-based payment resolution throughout the ecosystem

params._nameServiceAddress: Address of the deployed NameService contract for identity resolution
params._treasuryAddress: Address of the Treasury contract for balance management operations

acceptAdmin().details: Can only be called by the proposed admin after the time delay

acceptImplementation().details: Executes the proxy upgrade to the new implementation contract

addAmountToUser(address,address,uint256).custom:security: No overflow protection needed due to controlled access
addAmountToUser(address,address,uint256).details: Restricted function that can only be called by the authorized treasury contract Treasury Operations: - Allows treasury to mint or credit tokens to user accounts - Used for reward distributions, airdrops, or token bridging - Direct balance manipulation bypasses normal transfer restrictions - No signature verification required (treasury authorization) Access Control: - Only the registered treasury contract can call this function - Reverts with SenderIsNotTreasury error for unauthorized callers - Provides centralized token distribution mechanism Use Cases: - Cross-chain bridge token minting - Administrative reward distributions - System-level token allocations - Emergency balance corrections

params.amount: Amount of tokens to add to the user's balance
params.token: Address of the token contract to add balance for
params.user: Address of the user to receive tokens

addBalance(address,address,uint256).details: This function is intended for testnet use only to provide tokens for testing

params.quantity: The amount of tokens to add to the user's balance
params.token: The address of the token contract to add balance for
params.user: The address of the user to receive the balance

caPay(address,address,uint256).details: Allows registered contracts to distribute tokens without signature verification Authorization Model: - Only smart contracts (non-EOA addresses) can call this function - Calling contract must have sufficient token balance - No signature verification required (contract-level authorization) - Used primarily for automated distributions and rewards Use Cases: - Staking contract reward distributions - NameService fee distributions - Automated system payouts - Cross-contract token transfers Security Features: - Validates caller is a contract (has bytecode) - Checks sufficient balance before transfer - Direct balance manipulation for efficiency

params.amount: Amount of tokens to transfer from calling contract
params.token: Address of the token contract to transfer

constructor.custom:deployment: Must be followed by NameService and Treasury setup
constructor.custom:security: Admin address has full control over system configuration
constructor.details: Sets up the core system parameters, admin roles, and initial Principal Token allocations Critical Initial Setup: - Configures admin address with full administrative privileges - Sets staking contract address for reward distribution and status management - Stores EVVM metadata including principal token address and reward parameters - Distributes initial MATE tokens to staking contract (2x reward amount) - Registers staking contract as privileged staker with full benefits - Activates breaker flag for one-time NameService and Treasury setup Token Distribution: - Staking contract receives 2x current reward amount in MATE tokens - Enables immediate reward distribution capabilities - Provides operational liquidity for staking rewards Security Initialization: - Sets admin.current for immediate administrative access - Prepares system for NameService and Treasury integration - Establishes staking privileges for the staking contract Post-Deployment Requirements: - Must call `_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress()` to complete integration - NameService and Treasury addresses must be configured before full operation - Implementation contract should be set for proxy functionality

params._evvmMetadata: Metadata structure containing principal token address, reward amounts, and system parameters
params._initialOwner: Address that will have administrative privileges over the contract
params._stakingContractAddress: Address of the staking contract for reward distribution and staker management

disperseCaPay((uint256,address)[],addres.details: Allows authorized contracts to distribute tokens to multiple recipients efficiently Batch Distribution Features: - Single call distributes to multiple recipients - Supports both direct addresses and identity resolution - Validates total amount matches sum of individual distributions - Optimized for contract-based automated distributions Authorization Model: - Only smart contracts can call this function - No signature verification required (contract authorization) - Calling contract must have sufficient balance for total distribution Use Cases: - Bulk reward distributions from staking contracts - Multi-recipient fee distributions - Batch payroll or dividend distributions - Cross-contract multi-party settlements

params.amount: Total amount to distribute (must equal sum of individual amounts)
params.toData: Array of recipient data containing addresses/identities and amounts
params.token: Address of the token contract to distribute

dispersePay(address,(uint256,address,str.details: Efficient single-source multi-recipient payment distribution with signature verification Distribution Features: - Single signature authorizes distribution to multiple recipients - Supports both direct addresses and identity-based recipients - Proportional amount distribution based on recipient configurations - Integrated priority fee and staker reward system - Supports both sync and async nonce management Verification Process: - Validates single signature for entire distribution - Checks total amount and priority fee against sender balance - Ensures executor permissions and nonce validity - Processes each recipient distribution atomically Staker Benefits: - Executor receives priority fee (if staker) - MATE reward based on number of successful distributions

params.amount: Total amount to distribute (must match sum of individual amounts)
params.executor: Address authorized to execute this distribution
params.priorityFee: Fee amount for the transaction executor
params.priorityFlag: True for async nonce, false for sync nonce
params.toData: Array of recipient data with addresses/identities and amounts
params.token: Address of the token contract to distribute

getBalance(address,address).details: Returns the current balance stored in the EVVM system

returns._0: Current token balance for the user

getCurrentAdmin().details: Returns the address with administrative privileges over the contract

returns._0: Address of the current admin

getCurrentImplementation().details: Returns the implementation used by the proxy for delegatecalls

returns._0: Address of the current implementation contract

getEraPrincipalToken().details: Returns the token supply threshold that triggers the next reward halving

returns._0: Current era tokens threshold

getEvvmID().details: Returns the EvvmID used for distinguishing different EVVM deployments

returns._0: Unique EvvmID string

getEvvmMetadata().details: Provides access to system-wide configuration and economic parameters Metadata Contents: - Principal token address (Principal Token) - Current reward amount per transaction - Total supply tracking - Era tokens threshold for reward transitions - System configuration parameters

returns._0: Complete EvvmMetadata struct with all system parameters

getIfUsedAsyncNonce(address,uint256).details: Verifies nonce status to prevent replay attacks in async payments

params.user: Address to check nonce usage for

returns._0: True if the nonce has been used, false if still available

getNameServiceAddress().details: Returns the address used for identity resolution in payments

returns._0: Address of the integrated NameService contract

getNextCurrentSyncNonce(address).details: Returns the expected nonce for the next sync payment transaction

params.user: Address to check sync nonce for

returns._0: Next synchronous nonce value

getNextFisherDepositNonce(address).details: Returns the expected nonce for the next cross-chain deposit

params.user: Address to check deposit nonce for

returns._0: Next Fisher Bridge deposit nonce

getPrincipalTokenTotalSupply().details: Returns the current total supply used for era transition calculations

returns._0: Total supply of MATE tokens

getProposalAdmin().details: Returns the address pending approval for admin privileges

returns._0: Address of the proposed admin (zero if no pending proposal)

getProposalImplementation().details: Returns the implementation pending approval for proxy upgrade

returns._0: Address of the proposed implementation contract (zero if none)

getRewardAmount().details: Returns the base reward distributed to stakers for transaction processing

returns._0: Current reward amount in MATE tokens

getStakingContractAddress().details: Returns the address that can modify staker status and receive rewards

returns._0: Address of the integrated staking contract

getTimeToAcceptAdmin().details: Returns timestamp when the proposed admin can accept the role

returns._0: Timestamp when admin change can be executed (0 if no pending proposal)

getTimeToAcceptImplementation().details: Returns timestamp when the proposed implementation can be accepted

returns._0: Timestamp when implementation upgrade can be executed (0 if no pending proposal)

getWhitelistTokenToBeAdded().details: Returns the token address that can be whitelisted after time delay

returns._0: Address of the token prepared for whitelisting (zero if none)

getWhitelistTokenToBeAddedDateToSet().details: Returns timestamp when prepared tokens can be added to whitelist

returns._0: Timestamp when pending token can be whitelisted (0 if no pending proposal)

isAddressStaker(address).details: Verifies staker status for transaction processing privileges and rewards

params.user: Address to check staker status for

returns._0: True if the address is a registered staker

params.executor: Address authorized to execute this transaction (zero address = sender only)
params.priorityFee: Additional fee for transaction priority (not used in non-staker payments)
params.priorityFlag: Execution type flag (false = sync nonce, true = async nonce)
params.to_address: Direct recipient address (used if to_identity is empty)
params.token: Address of the token contract to transfer

payMultiple((address,address,string,addr.details: Executes an array of payment operations with individual success/failure tracking Batch Processing Features: - Processes each payment independently (partial success allowed) - Returns detailed results for each transaction - Supports both staker and non-staker payment types - Handles both sync and async nonce types per payment - Provides comprehensive transaction statistics Payment Validation: - Each payment signature is verified independently - Nonce management handled per payment type (sync/async) - Identity resolution performed for each recipient - Balance updates executed atomically per payment Return Values: - successfulTransactions: Count of completed payments - failedTransactions: Count of failed payments - results: Boolean array indicating success/failure for each payment

params.payData: Array of PayData structures containing payment details

returns.results: Boolean array with success status for each payment
returns.successfulTransactions: Number of payments that completed successfully

pointStaker(address,bytes1).details: Can only be called by the authorized staking contract Staker Status Management: - Controls who can earn staking rewards and process transactions - Integrates with external staking contract for validation - Updates affect payment processing privileges and reward eligibility Access Control: - Only the registered staking contract can call this function - Ensures staker status changes are properly authorized

params.user: Address to update staker status for

proposeAdmin(address).details: Part of the time-delayed governance system for admin changes

params._newOwner: Address of the proposed new admin

proposeImplementation(address).details: Part of the time-delayed governance system for critical upgrades Upgrade Security: - 30-day time delay for implementation changes - Only admin can propose upgrades - Allows time for community review and validation - Can be rejected before acceptance deadline

params._newImpl: Address of the new implementation contract

recalculateReward().details: Implements deflationary tokenomics with halving mechanism and random rewards Era Transition Mechanism: - Activates when total supply exceeds current era token threshold - Moves half of remaining tokens to next era threshold - Halves the base reward amount for future transactions - Provides random Principal Token bonus to caller (1-5083x reward) Economic Impact: - Gradually reduces inflation through reward halving - Creates scarcity as era thresholds become harder to reach - Incentivizes early participation with higher rewards - Provides lottery-style bonus for triggering era transitions Requirements: - Total supply must exceed current era token threshold - Can be called by anyone when conditions are met

rejectProposalAdmin().details: Allows current admin to reject proposed admin changes

rejectUpgrade().details: Allows admin to reject proposed upgrades before the time delay expires

removeAmountFromUser(address,address,uin.details: Restricted function that can only be called by the authorized treasury contract Treasury Operations: - Allows treasury to burn or debit tokens from user accounts - Used for cross-chain bridging, penalties, or system corrections - Direct balance manipulation bypasses normal transfer protections - Can potentially create negative balances if not carefully managed Access Control: - Only the registered treasury contract can call this function - Reverts with SenderIsNotTreasury error for unauthorized callers - Provides centralized token withdrawal mechanism Use Cases: - Cross-chain bridge token burning - Administrative penalty applications - System-level token reclamations - Emergency balance corrections Security Considerations: - No underflow protection: treasury must ensure sufficient balance - Can result in unexpected negative balances if misused - Treasury contract should implement additional validation

params.amount: Amount of tokens to remove from the user's balance
params.token: Address of the token contract to remove balance for
params.user: Address of the user to remove tokens from

setEvvmID(uint256).details: Allows the admin to change the EVVM ID within a 1-day window after deployment

setNameServiceAddress(address).details: Allows admin to change the NameService integration address

params._nameServiceAddress: Address of the new NameService contract

setPointStaker(address,bytes1).details: This function is intended for testnet use only to configure staker points for testing

params.answer: The bytes1 value representing the staker status or answer
params.user: The address of the user to set as point staker

_setupNameServiceAndTreasuryAddress(addr.notice: One-time setup function to configure NameService and Treasury contract addresses

acceptAdmin().notice: Accepts a pending admin proposal and becomes the new admin

acceptImplementation().notice: Accepts a pending implementation upgrade after the time delay

addAmountToUser(address,address,uint256).notice: Adds tokens to a user's balance in the EVVM system

addBalance(address,address,uint256).notice: Faucet function to add balance to a user's account for testing purposes

caPay(address,address,uint256).notice: Contract-to-address payment function for authorized smart contracts

constructor.notice: Initializes the EVVM contract with essential configuration and token distributions

dispersePay(address,(uint256,address,str.notice: Distributes tokens from a single sender to multiple recipients

getBalance(address,address).notice: Gets the balance of a specific token for a user

getCurrentImplementation().notice: Gets the current active implementation contract address

getEraPrincipalToken().notice: Gets the current era token threshold for reward transitions

getEvvmID().notice: Gets the unique identifier string for this EVVM instance

getEvvmMetadata().notice: Returns the complete EVVM metadata configuration

getIfUsedAsyncNonce(address,uint256).notice: Checks if a specific async nonce has been used by a user

getNameServiceAddress().notice: Gets the current NameService contract address

getNextCurrentSyncNonce(address).notice: Gets the next synchronous nonce for a user

getNextFisherDepositNonce(address).notice: Gets the next Fisher Bridge deposit nonce for a user

getPrincipalTokenTotalSupply().notice: Gets the total supply of the principal token (MATE)

getProposalImplementation().notice: Gets the proposed implementation contract address

getRewardAmount().notice: Gets the current Principal Token reward amount per transaction

getStakingContractAddress().notice: Gets the authorized staking contract address

getTimeToAcceptAdmin().notice: Gets the acceptance deadline for the pending admin change

getTimeToAcceptImplementation().notice: Gets the acceptance deadline for the pending implementation upgrade

getWhitelistTokenToBeAdded().notice: Gets the address of the token pending whitelist approval

getWhitelistTokenToBeAddedDateToSet().notice: Gets the acceptance deadline for pending token whitelist proposals

isAddressStaker(address).notice: Checks if an address is registered as a staker

pay(address,address,string,address,uint2.notice: Processes single payments Payment Flow: - Validates signature authorization for the payment   (if synchronous nonce, uses nextSyncUsedNonce inside    the signature verification to verify the correct nonce) - Checks executor permission if specified - Validates synchronous nonce matches expected value - Resolves recipient address (identity or direct address) - If the fisher (msg.sender) is a staker:  - Transfers priority fee to the fisher  - Rewards the fisher with Principal tokens - Updates balances and increments nonce

payMultiple((address,address,string,addr.notice: Processes multiple payments in a single transaction batch

pointStaker(address,bytes1).notice: Updates staker status for a user address

proposeAdmin(address).notice: Proposes a new admin address with 1-day time delay

proposeImplementation(address).notice: Proposes a new implementation contract for the proxy with time delay

recalculateReward().notice: Triggers a reward recalculation and era transition in the token economy

rejectProposalAdmin().notice: Cancels a pending admin change proposal

rejectUpgrade().notice: Cancels a pending implementation upgrade proposal

removeAmountFromUser(address,address,uin.notice: Removes tokens from a user's balance in the EVVM system

setEvvmID(uint256).notice: Updates the EVVM ID with a new value, restricted to admin and time-limited

setNameServiceAddress(address).notice: Updates the NameService contract address for identity resolution

setPointStaker(address,bytes1).notice: Faucet function to set point staker status for testing purposes
